career-path-story.text: The Traditional Path. In the old world, career progression was slow. Most juniors spent 3 to 5 years before being considered mid-level, and another 2 to 5 years to reach senior. That's potentially a decade of waiting!
The AI Revolution. But the rules have changed. AI tools like Cursor, Claude, and GitHub Copilot are force multipliers. They don't replace engineers—they amplify what engineers can do.
Learn 10x Faster. AI explains code, patterns, and concepts on demand. Instead of spending hours searching documentation, you get instant, contextual explanations tailored to your exact code.
Build 5x More. Ship features at a pace that impresses senior engineers. AI handles the boilerplate so you can focus on the interesting architecture and business logic problems.
The New Timeline. With AI augmentation, junior to mid-level takes 6 to 12 months. Mid to senior takes another 12 to 18 months. That's 18 to 24 months total—not 8 to 10 years!

acceleration-story.text: Work Differently, Not Harder. The difference between a 10-year journey and a 2-year journey isn't about working harder. It's about working differently. Let's explore the four principles that separate accelerators from the pack.

Think Like an Architect. Stop just completing tasks. Understand systems. See patterns across codebases. Design before you build. Ask 'why are we building this?' before asking 'how do I implement this?'
Use AI Strategically. AI isn't just for code generation. Use it for explanations on demand, code review assistance, and exploring alternative approaches. Make AI your 24/7 senior mentor.

Build Visible Impact. Ship features. Fix production bugs. Document systems that confuse others. Your work should be visible to your team and leadership. Impact that nobody sees doesn't advance your career.

Learn Deliberately. Read senior engineers' code. Ask 'why' not just 'how.' Seek feedback actively. Every PR review is a free lesson from someone more experienced. Don't just fix the comment—understand it.
The Accelerator Mindset. Combine all four principles and you become an accelerator. You're not just completing tickets—you're growing into a senior engineer at 5x the traditional pace.

production-code-story.text: Junior Code: It Works. Junior code typically works, but it's fragile. No type hints. No documentation. Maybe some SQL injection vulnerabilities. It solves the immediate problem but creates future problems.
Add Type Hints. Type hints tell other developers—and your IDE—exactly what your function expects and returns. They catch bugs before runtime and make code self-documenting.
Add Documentation. Docstrings explain the why, not just the what. What does this function do? What are the edge cases? What errors might it raise? Future you will thank present you.
Add Input Validation. Never trust input. Validate parameters. Use parameterized queries to prevent SQL injection. Raise meaningful errors for invalid inputs. Defense in depth.

Senior Code: Production Ready. The result is production-ready code. It's secure, maintainable, and self-documenting. And here's the secret: you can ask AI to transform junior code into senior code instantly!
